cards.kikuyu: Nda – stomach / pregnancy Nja – outside No – but O – them / even (o-na) Ta – like  -----------

cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Easy Kikuyu lessons by Emmanuel Kariuki, a native speaker preserving cultural wisdom. Traditional Kikuyu wisdom from Easy Kikuyu lessons This saying represents general wisdom passed down through generations, embodying Kikuyu cultural values and worldview.

cards.kikuyu: Here is the raw text from the image, presented in a code box: Noun Class 7 nouns : Abstract nouns wendo love ûrûme bravery ûtukû night ûrîmû foolishness watho law ûtihû face ûîru jealousy ûthamaki kingdom ûgeni a visit ûgo magic ûrogi witchcraft

cards.kikuyu: Here is the transcription of the text in the image: **Wagatano** - **Friday** **Hota** - able **Kũhota** - to be able **Kũhota** - to succeed **No ũhote** - are you able

cards.kikuyu: Here is the transcription of the text in the image: **Wakerĩ rũũcinĩ** **Tuesday morning** * **Metha** (table) **ĩyo nĩ njega** * That table is good * **Riiko** (cooker) **rĩũ nĩ rĩega** * That cooker is good * **Macani** (tea leaves) **mau nĩ mega** * Those tea leaves are good * **Mboco** (beans) **icio nĩ njega** * Those beans are good * **Gĩkombe** (cup) **kĩu nĩ kĩega** * That cup is good * **Riiko** - **Cooker** * **Riiko** - **Kitchen**
